content.body:
## Description
Set up continuous integration and continuous deployment pipeline for the Web API project.

## Tasks
- [ ] Create GitHub Actions workflow files
- [ ] Configure build process
- [ ] Set up test execution in CI
- [ ] Configure code quality checks (linting, formatting)
- [ ] Set up security scanning
- [ ] Configure deployment to development/staging environments
- [ ] Add status badges to README

## Acceptance Criteria
- CI pipeline runs on each push and pull request
- Tests are executed automatically
- Code quality checks are enforced
- Secure deployments to target environments
- Pipeline results are visible in GitHub
content.title: Configure CI/CD pipeline

milestone.title: Milestone 3: Quality and Deployment

content.body:
## Description
Configure unit, integration, and API testing infrastructure for the Web API project.

## Tasks
- [ ] Set up test project with appropriate framework (xUnit, NUnit, MSTest)
- [ ] Configure mocking library (Moq, NSubstitute)
- [ ] Create base classes for different test types
- [ ] Set up test database for integration tests
- [ ] Implement API endpoint tests
- [ ] Configure code coverage reporting
- [ ] Set up continuous testing in CI/CD

## Acceptance Criteria
- Unit tests for service and business logic
- Integration tests for database operations
- API tests for endpoint functionality
- Test configuration is environment-independent
- Code coverage reports are generated
content.title: Set up testing infrastructure

content.body:
## Description
Set up comprehensive logging and error handling mechanisms for the Web API.

## Tasks
- [ ] Configure logging provider (Serilog, NLog, etc.)
- [ ] Implement global exception handling middleware
- [ ] Create custom exception types for domain-specific errors
- [ ] Set up structured logging with appropriate log levels
- [ ] Configure log storage (file, database, cloud service)
- [ ] Implement error response standardization

## Acceptance Criteria
- All exceptions are properly caught and handled
- Error responses follow a consistent format
- Logging provides adequate information for troubleshooting
- Different environments have appropriate logging levels
- Sensitive data is not logged
content.title: Implement logging and error handling

content.body:
## Description
Implement and configure Swagger/OpenAPI documentation for the Web API to provide interactive API documentation.

## Tasks
- [ ] Install Swashbuckle.AspNetCore NuGet package
- [ ] Configure Swagger generation in Program.cs/Startup.cs
- [ ] Add XML comments support for documentation
- [ ] Customize Swagger UI with API information
- [ ] Add security definitions for authentication
- [ ] Configure Swagger document versions

## Acceptance Criteria
- Swagger UI accessible at /swagger endpoint
- API operations are properly documented
- Authentication is integrated with Swagger UI
- Models have proper descriptions
- Swagger page is customized with API info
content.title: Configure Swagger/OpenAPI documentation

## Description
Set up authentication and authorization mechanisms for the Web API using JWT, OAuth, or Identity.

## Tasks
- [ ] Configure authentication middleware
- [ ] Implement JWT token generation and validation
- [ ] Set up authorization policies
- [ ] Add role-based access control
- [ ] Secure endpoints with appropriate attributes
- [ ] Create user authentication endpoints (login, register)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Authentication works for protected endpoints
- JWT tokens are properly generated and validated
- Role-based permissions are enforced
- User identity is accessible in controllers
- Auth configuration follows security best practices

## Description
Configure database access using Entity Framework Core as the ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) tool.

## Tasks
- [ ] Install required EF Core NuGet packages
- [ ] Create DbContext class with entity configurations
- [ ] Configure connection string in appsettings.json
- [ ] Set up migrations for database versioning
- [ ] Implement repository pattern for data access
- [ ] Configure database provider (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Database connection works correctly
- Entity configurations follow best practices
- Migration system is set up properly
- Data access follows repository pattern
- Connection strings are properly secured
content.title: Set up database integration with Entity Framework Core

## Description
Set up Dependency Injection (DI) to handle service registration and lifecycle management for the API.

## Tasks
- [ ] Configure built-in DI container in Program.cs/Startup.cs
- [ ] Register services with appropriate lifetimes (Singleton, Scoped, Transient)
- [ ] Implement service interfaces and their implementations
- [ ] Set up options pattern for configuration objects
- [ ] Document service dependencies

## Acceptance Criteria
- All services properly registered in DI container
- Services have appropriate lifetime scopes
- Service interfaces follow SOLID principles
- Dependencies are properly injected into controllers
content.title: Configure Dependency Injection and services

Create data models and DTOs (Data Transfer Objects) to represent resources in the API.

Create controllers and endpoints for the Web API to handle HTTP requests.

- [ ] Create a base controller class with common functionality

## Description
Create the initial project structure for a .NET Web API application.

## Tasks
- [ ] Create a new .NET Web API project using `dotnet new webapi`
- [ ] Set up proper folder structure (Controllers, Models, Services, etc.)
- [ ] Configure project properties and settings
- [ ] Add solution file for better organization
- [ ] Document project structure

## Acceptance Criteria
- Project builds successfully
- Basic folder structure is established
- Solution file includes the API project
content.title: Set up .NET Web API project structure

nodes.text: Set up .NET Web API project structure

content.body:
This PR implements a complete web API setup for the project, transforming an empty repository into a fully functional RESTful API service.

## What was implemented

**Core API Infrastructure:**
- Express.js server with proper middleware configuration
- CORS support for cross-origin requests
- Environment-based configuration with `.env` files
- Request logging and comprehensive error handling
- JSON request/response handling with standardized formats

**API Endpoints:**
- `GET /health` - Health check endpoint for monitoring
- `GET /api` - API information and endpoint documentation
- Complete user management CRUD operations:
  - `GET /api/users` - List all users
  - `GET /api/users/:id` - Get specific user
  - `POST /api/users` - Create new user
  - `PUT /api/users/:id` - Update existing user
  - `DELETE /api/users/:id` - Delete user

**Developer Experience:**
- Comprehensive documentation in `README.md`
- API usage examples in `API_EXAMPLES.md` with curl, JavaScript, and Python samples
- Automated setup script (`setup.sh`) for quick development environment setup
- Proper `.gitignore` for Node.js projects
- Environment configuration templates

## Key Features

**Response Format Standardization:**
All API responses follow a consistent format for both success and error cases:
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {...},
  "message": "Optional message"
}
```

**Error Handling:**
Comprehensive error handling with appropriate HTTP status codes and descriptive error messages.

**Security:**
- All dependencies verified against GitHub Advisory Database (no vulnerabilities)
- CodeQL security analysis passed
- Input validation on all endpoints
- Environment variable configuration for sensitive data

## Testing

The API has been thoroughly tested with all endpoints verified to work correctly:

![API Response](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6c2b0c37-3ec0-4d62-ad71-44335d0f567b)

## Quick Start

After merging, developers can get started immediately:
```bash
./setup.sh    # Automated setup
npm run dev   # Start development server
```

The API will be available at `http://localhost:3000` with full documentation accessible via the `/api` endpoint.

## Future Ready

The implementation provides a solid foundation that can be easily extended with:
- Database integration (structure already supports it)
- Authentication and authorization
- Additional business logic endpoints
- API versioning
- Rate limiting and caching

This setup follows best practices and provides everything needed to begin API development immediately.

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT SUFFIX -->



<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT TIPS -->
---

 Let Copilot coding agent [set things up for you](https://github.com/octodemo/rulasg-dev-1/issues/new?title=+Set+up+Copilot+instructions&body=Configure%20instructions%20for%20this%20repository%20as%20documented%20in%20%5BBest%20practices%20for%20Copilot%20coding%20agent%20in%20your%20repository%5D%28https://gh.io/copilot-coding-agent-tips%29%2E%0A%0A%3COnboard%20this%20repo%3E&assignees=copilot)  coding agent works faster and does higher quality work when set up for your repo.
content.title: Create comprehensive web API setup with Node.js and Express

nodes.text: Create comprehensive web API setup with Node.js and Express

content.body:
This PR addresses the requirement to create 10 issues that describe the tasks needed to initialize the development of a web API on .NET. Since direct GitHub issue creation is not possible through automation, this solution provides comprehensive documentation that can be used to manually create the required issues.

## What's Added

###  Four comprehensive documentation files:

1. **`DEVELOPMENT_TASKS.md`** - A detailed 13,400+ character guide containing:
   - 10 structured development tasks with full descriptions
   - Clear acceptance criteria for each task
   - Implementation guidance with code examples
   - Technical considerations and best practices
   - Estimated effort and priority levels

2. **`GITHUB_ISSUES_TEMPLATES.md`** - Ready-to-use templates for creating GitHub issues:
   - Complete issue templates with titles, labels, and descriptions
   - Proper dependency tracking between issues
   - Suggested labels and priorities for project management

3. **`README_SUMMARY.md`** - Quick reference guide with:
   - Overview of all 10 tasks organized by phases
   - Total effort estimation (35-50 hours)
   - Getting started instructions
   - Key benefits of the structured approach

4. **Updated `README.md`** - Enhanced main README with links to all documentation

##  10 Essential Tasks Covered

The tasks are organized into three phases for systematic implementation:

**Phase 1: Foundation (High Priority)**
- Initialize .NET Web API Project Structure
- Configure Basic API Framework and Middleware
- Implement Configuration Management System

**Phase 2: Core Features (Medium-High Priority)**
- Set Up Database Integration and Entity Framework
- Implement Authentication and Authorization
- Configure Logging and Monitoring

**Phase 3: Quality & Deployment (Medium Priority)**
- Create Comprehensive Testing Infrastructure
- Generate API Documentation with Swagger/OpenAPI
- Set Up CI/CD Pipeline
- Configure Deployment and Infrastructure

##  Key Features

- **Production-Ready**: Covers all aspects from development to deployment
- **Best Practices**: Incorporates modern .NET development standards
- **Dependency Management**: Clear task dependencies and implementation order
- **Code Examples**: Practical implementation snippets for each task
- **Comprehensive Coverage**: Includes security, testing, monitoring, and documentation

##  Usage

1. Review the detailed tasks in `DEVELOPMENT_TASKS.md`
2. Use templates from `GITHUB_ISSUES_TEMPLATES.md` to create actual GitHub issues
3. Follow the phased approach starting with foundation tasks
4. Reference the summary guide for quick navigation

This documentation provides a complete roadmap for building a professional-grade .NET Web API from initial setup to production deployment, ensuring nothing is overlooked in the development process.

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT SUFFIX -->



<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT TIPS -->
---

 You can make Copilot smarter by setting up custom instructions, customizing its development environment and configuring Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Learn more [Copilot coding agent tips](https://gh.io/copilot-coding-agent-tips) in the docs.
content.title: Create comprehensive .NET Web API development initialization documentation with 10 structured tasks

content.body:
## Description
Implement health checks and monitoring for the Web API to ensure system reliability and performance.

## Tasks
- [ ] Add health check endpoints with ASP.NET Core Health Checks
- [ ] Configure health check UI for visual monitoring
- [ ] Implement custom health checks for database, external services, etc.
- [ ] Set up reporting and alerting mechanisms
- [ ] Configure metrics collection (e.g., request duration, error rates)
- [ ] Document health check endpoints and monitoring procedures

## Acceptance Criteria
- Health check endpoints respond with appropriate status codes
- Custom health checks verify critical dependencies
- Health check UI provides overview of system health
- Metrics are collected for performance monitoring
- Alerting is configured for critical health issues
content.title: Implement health checks and monitoring

content.body:
## Description
Implement a versioning strategy for the API to support backward compatibility and future changes.

## Tasks
- [ ] Research versioning strategies (URL path, query string, header, media type)
- [ ] Implement chosen versioning approach using ASP.NET Core API Versioning
- [ ] Set up version-specific routes and controllers
- [ ] Configure Swagger to support multiple API versions
- [ ] Create documentation for API version lifecycle policy
- [ ] Implement version deprecation notifications

## Acceptance Criteria
- API supports multiple versions simultaneously
- Versioning information is clearly communicated in API responses
- Swagger UI displays different versions properly
- Version lifecycle policy is documented
- API consumers are notified of deprecated versions
content.title: Implement API versioning strategy

milestone.title: Milestone 2: Core Functionality
milestone.description: Implementation of core API features and data handling

content.body:
## Description
Implement rate limiting and throttling for the API to prevent abuse and ensure fair usage.

## Tasks
- [ ] Add rate limiting middleware (e.g., AspNetCoreRateLimit)
- [ ] Configure client-based rate limits
- [ ] Implement endpoint-specific throttling rules
- [ ] Set up IP-based rate limiting
- [ ] Add rate limit information to response headers
- [ ] Configure response handling for rate-limited requests
- [ ] Document rate limiting policy for API consumers

## Acceptance Criteria
- Rate limiting prevents excessive requests from single clients
- Different limits can be applied based on client identity
- Rate limit headers are included in API responses
- Appropriate status codes (429 Too Many Requests) are returned
- Rate limiting policy is clearly documented
content.title: Configure rate limiting and throttling

milestone.title: Milestone 2: Core Functionality
milestone.description: Implementation of core API features and data handling

content.body:
## Description
Set up a background processing system with message queues for handling long-running or resource-intensive tasks asynchronously.

## Tasks
- [ ] Select and configure message broker (RabbitMQ, Azure Service Bus, etc.)
- [ ] Implement worker service with .NET Worker Service template
- [ ] Create message producers in API controllers
- [ ] Implement message consumers in background service
- [ ] Set up retry policies and dead letter queues
- [ ] Configure monitoring and logging for background jobs
- [ ] Implement job status tracking and reporting

## Acceptance Criteria
- Long-running operations are processed asynchronously
- API can queue tasks for background processing
- Failed jobs are properly handled with retries
- Background processing status can be queried
- System is resilient to message broker outages
content.title: Implement background processing with message queue

content.body:
## Description
Design and implement a comprehensive caching strategy for the API to improve performance and reduce database load.

## Tasks
- [ ] Configure in-memory caching for development environment
- [ ] Set up distributed caching (Redis, SQL Server, etc.) for production
- [ ] Implement cache profiles for controller actions
- [ ] Add cache headers for HTTP caching (ETags, Cache-Control)
- [ ] Create cache invalidation strategy for data updates
- [ ] Implement response compression
- [ ] Document caching behavior for API consumers

## Acceptance Criteria
- Frequently accessed data is properly cached
- Cache invalidation occurs when data is modified
- Response headers include appropriate caching directives
- Cache-related configuration is environment-specific
- Performance improvements are measurable under load testing
content.title: Implement caching strategy
